snippet: The aid package passed 241 to 180, with 49 Republicans joining 192 Democrats to approve it, and it now goes to the Senate, where it is expected to pass.
abstract: House approves long-awaited $50.7 billion emergency bill to help victims of Hurricane Sandy; financial relief, along with nearly $10 billion aid package that Congress approved earlier this month, seeks to provide for huge needs that have arisen in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut and other states since hurricane struck in late October 2012.
lead_paragraph: The aid package passed 241 to 180, with 49 Republicans joining 192 Democrats to approve it, and it now goes to the Senate, where it is expected to pass.

headline.seo: House Approves $50.7 Billion in Emergency Aid for Storm Victims
headline.main: House Approves $50.7 Billion in Emergency Aid for Storm Victims
headline.print_headline: House Approves $50.7 Billion for Hurricane Victims; Senate Passage Is Expected
